page.title: 08FARMING IN SUTTON
page.content: There are 8 farms in the area.All but one of these are of the arable or market gardening variety.The reason for this is that there are two types of soil in the area-heavy clay which is excellent for growing corn and light,sandy soil-ideal for the growing of vegetables.At one time all the farms belonged to the Burgoyne family who came from France and settled in Sutton in the 13th century. Not long ago it took many people to work the farms of Sutton but nowadays most of the work is carried out by machinery.The machinery used on farms is very expensive.A combine harvester costs anything between seventy and eighty thousand pounds.
